casebody.data:
Kimarlo RAGLAND
v.
NASH-ROCKY MOUNT BOARD OF EDUCATION No. 251P16 Supreme Court of North Carolina. September 22, 2016 Kimarlo A. Ragland, Pro se. Ms. Deborah R. Stagner, Attorney at Law, For Nash-Rocky Mount Board Of Education.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the notice of appeal from the North Carolina Court of Appeals, filed by the Petitioner on the 8th of July 2016 in this matter pursuant to G.S. 7A-30, and the motion to dismiss the appeal for lack of substantial constitutional question filed by the Respondent, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals: the motion to dismiss the appeal is

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 22nd of September 2016."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 8th of July 2016 by Petitioner in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 22nd of September 2016."
